results.title: Machines like men
results.creator_credit: Philip Daly, BBC-TV, Michael Latham and Bill Wright
results.brief_description: Prescient and fascinating document from BBC-TV exploring the prehistory of contemporary information technology; the filmmakers elaborate some of the [primitive] computer’s potentials: text and voice recognition, simple deductive logic, computer assisted design and voice synthesis. Enquires into the development of robots and the problem this creation poses for human beings.

results.title: Machines do work
results.creator_credit: Young America Films and Peck-Warrin Productions
results.brief_description: Introduces the concept of simple machines. Discusses the lever, the inclined plane, the pulley, and the wheel and axle. Shows the contribution of the machine to our everyday life.

results.title: Machines and the farm
results.creator_credit: Random House and Agricultural Engineers Association
results.brief_description: A demonstration of the wide variety of agricultural equipment produced in Britain, and a review of the increasing efficiency of farm machinery. Illustrations include combine sowers and harvesters; fertilizers; irrigation pipes and sprays; muck spreaders; pea harvesters; and precision planting machines. Equipment of the future is exemplified in remotely controlled electronic tractors.

results.title: Machines and metal
results.brief_description: A film about McPherson’s Limited (Melbourne) suppliers for 100 years of machine tools, Macson lathes, Ajax nuts and bolts, Ajax water pumps and the making of these items.

results.title: Machine transcription: transcription technique
results.creator_credit: De Frenes and United States. Navy
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the correct method of phrasing, how to control and phrase at various speeds, how to prepare for a day’s work, compose a letter and how to correct errors in the transcription on the cylinder, the “Do’s and Don’ts” of good transcription.

results.title: Machine tools and motions
results.brief_description: On-the-job pictures show how a worker’s strength is taxed by badly located and incorrectly designed controls on machine shop equipment. The following three principles are elaborated: 1. Locate the machine control so that the operator can maintain normal posture and is not required to work within a dangerous area. 2. Design controls so that unnecessary motions are eliminated from the operations cycle. 3. Design the controls so that necessary motions are within the normal work area.

group_works.title: Lathe: work between centres
group_works.creator_credit: Joe Hayward, Helmut Engelhardt and Moreland-Latchford Productions

results.title: Machine operation
results.creator_credit: United States. Navy and De Frenes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic typing”.
Demonstrates correct stroking at speeds ranging from 35 to 180 words per minute. Explains the functions of the various parts of the typewriter and demonstrates the use of these on various types of machines. Demonstrates how to attain correct touch for noiseless, manual, and electric machines.
